keyword_roasts.roast: Uber? More like 'overpriced taxi with attitude.'
AI: Artificial Ignorance, clearly.
Voice assistants? More like 'voice irritants.'
Dog? More like 'barking up the wrong tree.'
Your chat is as lively as a dead battery.
Blockchain? More like 'block the fun.'
Cloud computing? More like 'fog of disappointment.'
Crypto? More like 'crippling your finances.'
Fintech or just fancy finance nonsense?
SaaS sounds like a bad acronym for laziness.
Food startup? Hope you serve more than stale ideas.
Fitness startup? Your gains are in bugs, not muscle.
Tutor? Your lessons must be on how to fail.
Farming innovation? More like crop of errors.
Drone startup? Sounds like a flying paperweight.
Ride-sharing? More like ride to nowhere.
Sleep tech? Hope your product isn't a nightmare.
Pet startup? Even your ideas need a walk.
Eco-friendly? Your green is just envy.
Loan startup? Prepare for a bankruptcy lesson.
Bike startup? Spinning wheels, going nowhere.
Car tech? You drive investors away.
Home startup? More like house of cards.
Data startup? Data error: idea not found.
Social app? Socially awkward, more like.
Green startup? Your idea's more toxic than helpful.
Health tech? Your app gives headaches.
Chatbot? More like chat-boring bot.
App? Another useless icon on my phone.
Delivery? Delivering disappointment on time.
Market startup? Just a flea market of ideas.
Travel tech? Your business plan took a detour.
Bot startup? Your bots are broken beyond repair.
Book startup? Reading between your lines is painful.
Photo app? Your pics are as blurry as your vision.
Video startup? Buffering your failures endlessly.
Game startup? More like a game of chance, and you lose.
Learn startup? Your lessons are lessons in failure.
Music app? Sounds like static noise to me.
Shop startup? Your shelves are empty.
Smart tech? Your smarts must be artificial too.
Payment startup? You owe your users an apology.
Taxi app? You just rerouted to disaster.
Wearable tech? You just accessorize your errors.
Money startup? Your profits are imaginary.
Finance app? Your balance sheets don't add up.
MedTech? Your cure is a virus.
Insurance startup? You can’t even insure your ideas.
Legal startup? Your arguments don’t hold up.
Robot startup? Your bots can't even clean up.
Edu startup? Your curriculum is all fail.
News app? You spread fake failure faster.
Tech startup? You tech me not to invest.
Sport startup? You just dropped the ball.
Cloudify? Your cloud just rains bugs.
Track startup? You lost the trail already.
Scan tech? You just scanned yourself out of business.
Print startup? Your pages are blank.
Link startup? Your connections are dead ends.
Grow startup? Your growth is just weeds.
Drive startup? You just stalled.
Clean tech? Your mess is digital.
Build startup? Your foundation is shaky.
Code startup? Your code crashed before launch.
Map startup? You lost your own way.
Test startup? You failed every one.
Security startup? You leak more than protect.
Save app? You just wasted my time.
Jump startup? You fell flat.
Lift startup? You just pulled your own plug.
As helpful as a screen door on a submarine. Useless.
Never has their wallet. Convenient.
Cares less than I do about diets. Zero.
Like a telemarketer. Unwanted.
Shocks worse than a surprise bill. Ouch.
Random noise. My grandma's TikToks make more sense.
Spreads gossip. Fast and furious.
Slower than molasses. Is anyone working?
Heavy as a brick. My foot hurts.
Ghosting everyone. Where did they go?
Stressful. Like last-minute concert tickets.
Automates failures. One job!
Empty. No one showed up.
Makes it worse. Like a bad haircut.
Email would be better. Waste of time.
Creates problems faster. Endless cycle.
Sinks faster than my mood. Bye bye.
Drips like a leaky faucet. So little.
Fashion disaster. And useless.
To frustration. Access denied.
Wrong time. Like my ex's promises.
Old as a rotary phone. Outdated.
Promises gains, delivers empty. Tricked.
Powered by rage quits. Not relaxing.
All surface, no substance. Fake.
Adds problems. Makes things worse.
Jams more than it runs. Get a new one.
Slow like a toddler. It's a process.
Big talk, tiny results. All bark.
Full of junk. Declutter!
Security as weak as my diet resolve. Broken.
Protects like a wet paper bag. Easy access.
Gives up fast. Like my diet.
Glitches galore. Just return it.
Like my excuses. Never-ending.
Drains phone battery. Fast.
More weeds than yield. Time to clean.
Yells, teaches nothing. Broken record.
Stresses me out. Mind racing.
Puts listeners in a coma. So boring.
Colors clash. My eyes hurt.
Pixel mess. Did a toddler draw this?
More toy than tool. Useless.
Crashes like my social life. Abruptly.
Leaks data. What's the point?
Forgets keys. Like my grocery list.
Spam factory. Zero respect.
Buries you in search hell. Lost.
So boring. Invisible.
Messes everything up. Chaos.
Forgotten fast. What happened?
Slow as paint drying. Load already!
Ghosts you. Support? Never heard of it.

fallback_roasts.roast: That idea? I've seen better pitches at a little league game.
Your startup's so confusing, even ChatGPT gave up.
Sounds like a solution desperately looking for a problem.
That’s not a pitch. That’s a cry for funding.
Your startup could get ghosted by investors *and* Tinder matches.
If ambition were execution, you'd still be in beta.
It’s giving ‘pivot in six months’ energy.
That pitch was so dry, even your TAM fell asleep.
Your idea’s got potential. To waste everyone's time.
Startup so vague it makes Web3 look straightforward.
Your elevator pitch needs stairs. And a nap.
That startup would be hot—if it were on fire.
You really said: ‘What if we made it worse, but scalable?’
Investors will pass faster than your page load time.
The only thing you’re disrupting is investor patience.
Your pitch deck just caused a market crash. Emotionally.
That idea belongs in a group chat, not a cap table.
You just reinvented failure. But with worse UX.
If buzzwords could code, maybe you'd have a product.
I’ve seen stealth startups with more clarity.
That pitch just soft-launched my will to live.
The future is here — and it's asking you to stop.
Your MVP stands for 'Most Vague Pitch.'
You just pitched a PowerPoint with trauma.
It's not a startup, it's a startup-themed escape room.
If confusion were a business model, you’d be profitable.
Your roadmap looks like a toddler’s crayon drawing.
Even your burn rate is ashamed of being associated.
You’re not pre-revenue, you're pre-relevance.
The pitch was so weak, it needs a Series A... of therapy.
You should pivot. Preferably into another industry.
Your ‘tech stack’ is just buzzwords duct-taped together.
That idea should’ve stayed in your Notes app.
You’re solving a problem no one has with tools no one needs.
I’ve heard fewer red flags in a North Korean parade.
Your market size is you, your cofounder, and your moms.
Investors would rather Venmo a scammer.
You talk lean but that pitch was all bloat.
The best part of your startup is the logo — maybe.
That’s not disruption. That’s digital littering.
Is your valuation based on vibes?
Your idea was so bad, autocorrect changed it to ‘stop.’
You're a unicorn — if failure was rare.
That’s not a pitch. That’s a DDoS on common sense.
Your startup's USP is how fast people walk away.
You built a rocket to nowhere. Congrats on lift-off.
Your ‘innovation’ is just a rerun with worse actors.
That pitch was so early, it’s still an embryo.
Your addressable market is probably just your reflection.
You made a startup nobody needed — not even ironically.
It’s like Uber, but for disappointing your parents.
Your demo crashed and so did our hopes.
You pitched an app that solves nothing but your boredom.
Even your NDA wants to forget this.
